content:
TITLE: Setting Environment Variables for AuthKit Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Environment variables configuration for WorkOS AuthKit setup, including Client ID and API Key settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/workos/authkit/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
WORKOS_CLIENT_ID="<your Client ID>"
WORKOS_API_KEY="<your Secret Key>"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Environment Variables for AuthKit Next.js Example
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the required environment variables for the authkit-nextjs library example. It includes the WorkOS redirect URI and a cookie password for session management.
SOURCE: https://github.com/workos/authkit/blob/main/src/app/using-hosted-authkit/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Needed for authkit-nextjs library example, defined in WorkOS dashboard
WORKOS_REDIRECT_URI=

# Needed for authkit-nextjs library example. Must be at least 32 characters long
WORKOS_COOKIE_PASSWORD=
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Hosted AuthKit Redirect URLs
DESCRIPTION: Redirect URL configurations for hosted AuthKit implementation with different integration options including basic, session-based, and Next.js implementations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/workos/authkit/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
http://localhost:3000/using-hosted-authkit/basic/callback
http://localhost:3000/using-hosted-authkit/with-session/callback
http://localhost:3000/using-hosted-authkit/with-nextjs/callback
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Custom UI OAuth Redirect URLs
DESCRIPTION: Redirect URL configurations for custom UI implementation using various OAuth providers including Google, Microsoft, GitHub, and SSO.
SOURCE: https://github.com/workos/authkit/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
http://localhost:3000/using-your-own-ui/sign-in/google-oauth/callback
http://localhost:3000/using-your-own-ui/sign-in/microsoft-oauth/callback
http://localhost:3000/using-your-own-ui/sign-in/github-oauth/callback
http://localhost:3000/using-your-own-ui/sign-in/sso/callback
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Environment Variable for SSO-Enabled Organization ID in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to set the SSO_ENABLED_ORGANIZATION_ID environment variable in a .env.local file. This is required for the Single Sign-On example and should be the Organization ID of an organization with an active SSO connection.
SOURCE: https://github.com/workos/authkit/blob/main/src/app/using-your-own-ui/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
SSO_ENABLED_ORGANIZATION_ID="<your Organization ID>"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting JWT Secret Key in Environment Variables
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to add the generated JWT secret key to the .env.local file for use in the client-side session management example.
SOURCE: https://github.com/workos/authkit/blob/main/src/app/using-hosted-authkit/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# ...
JWT_SECRET_KEY="<your JTW secret>"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Secure Cookie Password Using OpenSSL
DESCRIPTION: This command uses the OpenSSL library to generate a strong, random password for use as the WORKOS_COOKIE_PASSWORD in the authkit-nextjs example.
SOURCE: https://github.com/workos/authkit/blob/main/src/app/using-hosted-authkit/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
openssl rand -base64 24
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating JWT Secret Key for Client-Side Sessions
DESCRIPTION: This command uses OpenSSL to generate a random base64 string for use as the JWT secret key in the client-side session management example.
SOURCE: https://github.com/workos/authkit/blob/main/src/app/using-hosted-authkit/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
openssl rand -base64 32
```
